Boundary Level: depth 7.45 mm in the speleothem KM-A

GSSP Location: North Greenland Ice Core Project, core NGRIP1, central Greenland ice sheet
Boundary Level: 1228.67 m in the NGRIP1 ice core

GSSP Location: North Greenland Ice Core Project, core NGRIP2, central Greenland ice sheet
Boundary Level: 1492.45 m in the NGRIP2 ice core
Correlation Events: Climatic - End of the Younger Dryas Chron which is reflected in an abrupt shift to lower deuterium excess values
Status: Holocene GSSP ratifed 2008; Lower Holocene Subseries and Greenlandian Stage ratified: 2018

Age (Ma): GSSP presently undefined but provisionally dated at ~129 ka
Reference: Head, M.J., Pillans, B., and Zalasiewicz, J.A., [submitted 2020]

Boundary Level: lower boundary of the Byk-E tephra bed
Correlation Events: Magnetic – GSSP is 1.1 m below the directional midpoint of the Matuyama/Brunhes paleomagnetic reversal and occurs immediately below the top of Marine Isotope Substage 19c.

Boundary Level: base of the marine claystone overlying the sapropelic marker Bed 'e' (Mediterranean Precession Related Sapropel, MPRS 176)
Correlation Events: Magnetic - ~8m below the observed top of the Olduvai (C2n) normal polarity subchron. GSSP level coincides with the transition from MIS 65 to 64
Status: Ratified 1985 as base of Pleistocene; Ratified 2011 as base of Calabrian

Boundary Level: base of marly layer overlying sapropel MPRS 250
Correlation Events: Magnetic - Matuyama/Gauss boundary (C2r/C2An) is between ~0 and ~3 m above GSSP (Head, 2019) not ~1 m (20 kyr) below it as reported by Rio et al. (1994, 1998). GSSP level is within Marine Isotope Stage 103.
Status: Ratified 1996 as base of Gelasian; Ratified 2009 as base of Pleistocene and Quaternary
